page.title: 16A Playground,Stoke
page.content: The Adventure Playground was built in 1973.The original idea was put forward by Mrs Redmond.The 'Adventure' as it is called by the locals was built on the filled in Newcastle canal.It used to be a dump but parents cleared it up.It was built because there was no where for the children to play. The Adventure is paid for in two ways,by the Hanley Youth Project and by the local community.The helpers have to be trained.The leader came into school to talk to us about the Adventure.He thought more money should be spent on childrens play areas. The playground has got monkey bars, big concrete pipes,a B.M.X. course,a slide and a wooden frame with ropes. There is also a hut where parents play bingo and pool. Every year there is a bonfire party.A really big bonfire is built.
